about.title: About Us
about.church: The International Anglican Revival Ministries is a vibrant Christian community dedicated to spiritual growth, compassion, and service. We are an Anglican-Pentecostal/Protestant church committed to preaching the Gospel, nurturing families, and empowering believers for a purpose-driven life.
about.congregation: We serve a diverse congregation in Edmonton, including Canadians and African communities, offering worship services in English and Kinyarwanda.
about.ministry: Our ministry extends beyond Canada, partnering with churches in Africa and supporting vulnerable refugees, widows, orphans, and displaced families in Uganda, Kenya, Rwanda, and other regions.
about.visionText: To connect families and communities—both in Edmonton and globally—to transformational development, spiritual growth, and faith-based opportunities that promote holistic wellbeing and sustainable change.
about.missionText: Our mission is to empower individuals and communities through spiritual formation, social support, and holistic development. We promote faith-driven aspirations that help vulnerable groups realize their God-given potential.
marksList: Proclaim the Good News of the Kingdom of God.
Challenge and transform unjust structures in society.
Support church planting and spiritual development in Africa.
Implement programs that serve refugees and vulnerable families in Africa.
about.pastor: Apostle Rev. Jean Sengiyumva, Senior Pastor
about.pastorBio: Apostle Rev. Sengiyumva is a dedicated servant of God with a passion for multi-lingual ministry. Although English is not his first language, he faithfully ministers in English and Kinyarwanda to reach and uplift diverse communities. His calling is rooted in Jeremiah 20:9, carrying God's Word like fire in his bones.
about.coreValuesDesc: These fundamental values guide everything we do as a church community, shaping our mission, ministry, and relationships.

values.title: Faith
values.description: We trust in God's Word and His promises, living by faith and not by sight. Our faith in Jesus Christ is the foundation of our church.

values.description: We demonstrate Christ's unconditional love to everyone, showing compassion, kindness, and acceptance to all people regardless of their background.

values.description: We serve God and others with humility and dedication, following Christ's example of servant leadership in our community and beyond.

values.description: We build authentic relationships and fellowship, creating a welcoming family where everyone belongs and can grow together in faith.

values.title: Integrity
values.description: We live with honesty, transparency, and moral principles, reflecting Christ's character in all our actions and decisions.

about.statementOfFaithDesc: We believe in the fundamental truths of the Christian faith as revealed in the Holy Scriptures.
statementOfFaithItems: We believe in one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

We believe in the deity of our Lord Jesus Christ, in His virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His atoning death, in His bodily resurrection, and in His ascension to the right hand of the Father.
We believe in the present ministry of the Holy Spirit, by whose indwelling the Christian is enabled to live a godly life.
We believe in the Bible as the inspired, infallible, and authoritative Word of God.
We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost: the saved unto the resurrection of life, and the lost unto the resurrection of damnation.
We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in our Lord Jesus Christ.
about.historyDesc: The International Anglican Revival Ministries was established to serve the growing international and multicultural community in Edmonton, particularly those from African backgrounds seeking a place of worship that honors both Anglican tradition and Pentecostal expression.
historyContent: Founded with a vision to bridge cultures and languages, our church began as a small gathering of believers committed to sharing the Gospel in both English and Kinyarwanda.
Over the years, we have grown into a vibrant community that serves not only the local Edmonton area but also extends our ministry to support vulnerable communities in Africa.
Today, we continue to be a beacon of hope, providing spiritual guidance, community support, and practical assistance to those in need, both locally and globally.

foundation.title: Shelter of Refugee Seniors International Ministries (SRSIM)
foundation.subtitle: Serving vulnerable refugees, seniors, and displaced families with compassion and dignity
foundation.aboutDesc: Shelter of Refugee Seniors International Ministries (SRSIM) is a compassionate ministry dedicated to serving vulnerable refugees, seniors, and displaced families around the world. We provide essential support, resources, and hope to those who have been forced to flee their homes due to conflict, persecution, or natural disasters.
foundation.missionText1: Holistic care—physical, emotional, spiritual—for elderly refugees, offering shelter, health support, advocacy, and community integration.
foundation.missionText2: Our mission is to safeguard the dignity and improve the quality of life of refugee seniors through shelter provision, access to healthcare, counseling, and empowerment, grounded in faith and compassion.
foundation.missionText3: We commit to serving elderly refugees by offering safe lodging, nutritious food, social and spiritual support, and resources to help them rebuild hope and participate fully in society.
foundation.visionText1: A world where every elderly refugee lives with dignity, security, and peace, embraced by a supportive community.
foundation.visionText2: To become a haven of hope and renewal for aging refugees, where care, compassion, and respect restore strength and belonging.
foundation.visionText3: Where refugee seniors are empowered to live full, meaningful lives, free from fear and isolation.

valuesList.title: Compassion
valuesList.desc: We serve with empathy and kindness, recognizing the unique struggles and dignity of every refugee senior.

valuesList.title: Dignity
valuesList.desc: We uphold the inherent worth of each person, ensuring our elders are treated with respect, honor, and care—regardless of background or circumstance.

valuesList.title: Faith in Action
valuesList.desc: Rooted in our spiritual beliefs, we translate our faith into tangible acts of service, offering hope, healing, and community to those in need.

foundation.recentActivity1: We have provided bed covers to 85 Refugee Seniors at Mbarara Refugee camp in Uganda. This cost us $1,000 USD.

challengesList.title: High Vulnerability & Displacement Conditions
challengesList.desc: When conflict erupts (e.g. in North Kivu, DRC), older people are among those who suffer most. They often can't flee quickly and are exposed to danger. Many older people remain in hastily formed displacement sites or camps, or in temporary shelters like schools, often without basic facilities.

challengesList.title: Food Insecurity & Nutrition
challengesList.desc: Refugees older people often arrive without food or access to cooking supplies. Their nutritional needs are frequently unmet, especially if they have difficulty chewing, chronic illness, or need specialised diets.

challengesList.title: Health Issues, Chronic Disease & Medical Care Gaps
challengesList.desc: Refugees Older people often have pre-existing chronic health conditions (e.g. hypertension, arthritis) that need ongoing care and medication. Conflict and displacement aggravate these. Access to clean water and sanitation is a major challenge; poor water increases risk of waterborne diseases and cholera. Health services in camps often do not have specialised geriatric care or services adapted to older people's mobility or sensory impairments.

challengesList.title: Shelter, Safety and Living Conditions
challengesList.desc: Shelters can be inadequate (leaking, crowded, poorly insulated, not adapted to mobility limitations). Sanitation facilities (latrines, toilets) may be hard to reach or use for those who are weak or have limited mobility. Raised seats or facilities far away are a problem.

challengesList.title: Social Isolation, Protection, and Dignity
challengesList.desc: Elder refugees often means loss of family or community support networks. Older people are alone and dependent on others. There are risks of neglect, abuse (verbal, physical, sexual) especially for older women. Some reports mention that elderly in camps feel less respected, more marginalized. Mental health—trauma, grief, loss, uncertainty—these are major issues.
